thread.title: Chandrababu Naidu sprinkles water and soil brought from across the state over Amaravati | Deccan Chronicle
thread.title_full: Chandrababu Naidu sprinkles water and soil brought from across the state over Amaravati | Deccan Chronicle

author: Deccan
title: Chandrababu Naidu sprinkles water and soil brought from across the state over Amaravati | Deccan Chronicle
text:
Deccan Chronicle | October 21, 2015, 17.46 pm Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu sprinkling water and soil brought from across the state over Amaravati (Photo: Twitter) Guntur : Soil and water that had been brought from across the state for the foundation ceremony was sprinkled all over Amaravati from helicopter by Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu on Wednesday.
Naidu flagged off the Amaravati Sankalpa Jyothi yatra with water and soil kalasams from Acharya Nagarjuna University to Uddandarayunipalem.
He said the government had collected the water and soil from all places in a record five days.
Nearly 20,000 water and soil pitchers from 16,000 villages and 4,000 wards of the AP have been received, apart from contributions from elsewhere.
The CRDA also sprinkle holy soil and water in the CRDA lands through helicopters.
Religious prayers were held to give sanctity to the water and soil by priests of Hindu, Muslim, Christian and Buddhist communities.
Also read:
Amaravati will be world class, says Chandrababu Naidu
Chandrababu Naidu seeks special status tag for Andhra Pradesh before Amaravati fete
Chandrababu Naidu lights up Sankalpa Jyothi
Telangana contributes soil for Andhra Pradesh’s Capital
Cycle rally from Hyderabad to Amaravati turns controversial

Sky lanterns to be part of D-Day
New Andhra Pradesh capital: Hyderabad hoteliers get a sinking feeling
Telugu Netizens welcome K Chandrasekhar Rao’s proposed visit to AP capital ceremony
Earlier addressing a gathering on Tuesday, Naidu said “trying is human nature and blessings of almighty will complete the tasks” hence they are trying to given divine power to the water and soil by taking blessings of all gods and goddesses for the swift completion of Amaravati construction.
He said that My Amaravati-My Brick got huge success and Amaravati became a topic of discussion in every house. He said that the government decided to involve the public in the new capital establishment so started brick portal and further water and soil programme.
Naidu said that this is people’s capital hence it is located on the banks of Krishna River which’s distance is equal to various areas of the AP and reachable to every one from 13 districts.
He predicted that Amaravati got first success with the successful participation of the public and claimed that works started on Vijayadasami would be victorious and Amaravati would be a successful biggest public capital in the future. He added that presence of Amaravati sculptures in the London museum is a pride to the Telugus. The CM said that due to the power of ancient Amaravati, the works are progressing swiftly and Singaporeans also gave Capital Master Plan in six months of period honouring Amaravati where Buddhism blessed the public.
 chandrababu Naidu Andhra Pradesh Amaravati South Soil and water from 16,000 villages sprinkled over Amaravati Loading... Please Wait 1/16 Soil and water which was brought from villages across state was sprinkled from a helicopter all over Amaravati by Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu on Wednesday. The foundation stone laying ceremony will take place on October 22. (Photo: Twitter) 2/16 Nearly 20,000 water and soil pitchers from 16,000 villages and 4,000 wards of the AP have been received, apart from contributions from elsewhere. 3/16 Religious prayers were held to give sanctity to the water and soil by priests of Hindu, Muslim, Christian and Buddhist communities. (Photo: Twitter) 4/16 Naidu said that this is people’s capital hence it is located on the banks of Krishna River which distance is equal to various areas of the AP and reachable to every one from 13 districts. (Deccan Chronicle) 5/16 Workers making Chakkera Pongali and Pulihora for people at Uddandarayuni palem in Amaravati. (Photo: Deccan Chronicle) 6/16 Police in large numbers have been deployed at the venue and nearby areas to provide security to the arriving guests. (Photo: Deccan Chronicle) 7/16 A huge cut out of Chandrababu Naidu and Narendra Modi was prepared to welcome both the dignitaries for the Foundation ceremony. (Photo: Deccan Chronicle) 8/16 A cycle rally from Hyderabad to Amaravati was organised on October 19, in support of the TD rule of 502 days on the occasion of the Foundation ceremony of the capital. (Photo: Deccan Chronicle) 9/16 Elaborate arrangements are being made in Guntur district for the foundation stone laying ceremony. 10/16 Workers are giving finishing touches to the VIP dais and Amaravthi Sankalpa Jyothi Platform. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will lay the foundation stone for the capital city. 11/16 Barricading works in progress at the ceremony venue. Chandrababu Naidu also extended an invitation to K Chandrasekhar Rao to attend the ceremony which the Telangana Chief Minister gracefully accepted. 12/16 Adilakshmi the first women who gave farm land under LPS receiving silk clothes and invitatation for foundation ceremony from ministers P.Pulla Rao, P.Narayana, Vijayawada MP K. Nani. 13/16 Guntur Collector Kantilal Dande along with Guntur Range IG N. Sanjay inspecting the works of Amaravthi Sankalpa Jyothi Platform. 14/16 The arrangements at the venue include three daises, which will host the Prime Minister flanked by the two VVIPs. 15/16 Different sections of people and government departments including police and advocates collected water and soil from various divisions in Kakinada for construction of capital. 16/16 Members of the Muslim community from various localities of Guntur and Krishna districts also gathered at the venue praying for smooth conduct of the function on October 22.
